item.title: Zyxel warns of bad signature update causing firewall boot loops
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Zyxel is warning that a bad security signature update is causing critical errors for USG FLEX or ATP Series firewalls, including putting the device into a boot loop. [...]

item.title: Microsoft to deprecate WSUS driver synchronization in 90 days
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has reminded Windows administrators that driver synchronization in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) will be deprecated on April 18, 90 days from now. [...]

item.title: Subaru Starlink flaw let hackers hijack cars in US and Canada
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Security researchers have discovered an arbitrary account takeover flaw in Subaru's Starlink service that could let attackers track, control, and hijack vehicles in the United States, Canada, and Japan using just a license plate. [...]

item.title: Hackers use Windows RID hijacking to create hidden admin account
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A North Korean threat group has been using a technique called RID hijacking that tricks Windows into treating a low-privileged account as one with administrator permissions. [...]

item.title: Hacker infects 18,000 "script kiddies" with fake malware builder
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A threat actor targeted low-skilled hackers, known as "script kiddies," with a fake malware builder that secretly infected them with a backdoor to steal data and take over computers. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Outdated Exchange servers fail to auto-mitigate security bugs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says outdated Exchange servers cannot receive new emergency mitigation definitions because an Office Configuration Service certificate type is being deprecated. [...]

item.title: Managed Detection and Response – How are you monitoring?
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Smarttech247
item.description: Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems are now a critical component of enterprise security. Learn more from Smarttech247 about how its VisionX + Splunk solution can help secure your organization. [...]

item.title: Hackers get $886,250 for 49 zero-days at Pwn2Own Automotive 2025
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The Pwn2Own Automotive 2025 hacking contest has ended with security researchers collecting $886,250 after exploiting 49 zero-days. [...]

item.title: FBI: North Korean IT workers steal source code to extort employers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FBI warned today that North Korean IT workers are abusing their access to steal source code and extort U.S. companies that have been tricked into hiring them. [...]

item.title: Google launches customizable Web Store for Enterprise extensions
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google has officially launched its Chrome Web Store for Enterprises, allowing organizations to create a curated list of extensions that can be installed in employees' web browsers. [...]

item.title: Hundreds of fake Reddit sites push Lumma Stealer malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are distributing close to 1,000 web pages mimicking Reddit and the WeTransfer file sharing service that lead to downloading the Lumma Stealer malware. [...]

item.title: QNAP fixes six Rsync vulnerabilities in NAS backup, recovery app
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: QNAP has fixed six rsync vulnerabilities that could let attackers gain remote code execution on unpatched Network Attached Storage (NAS) devices. [...]

item.title: New Android Identity Check locks settings outside trusted locations
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google has announced a new Android "Identity Check" security feature that lock sensitive settings behind biometric authentication when outside a trusted location. [...]
